location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No 419 of 1851 from Lieutenant Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, at Bushire to Lieutenant Colonel Justin Sheil, HM Minister Plenipotentiary and Envoy Extraordinary at the Court of Persia, Tehran

mods.abstract: The letter is reporting that Mahomed Haskim Khan was attacked while engaged in the siege of Fort Hurrum in Lar [LƒÅr] by Bakir Marmaee, and defeated. It further reports that Mirza Hadee Khan of Jehramee has in consequence been subjected to torture to force him be pay out a large sum of money; it is explained the pretext for this is that he did not provide enough assistance to the aforementioned Mahomed Haskim Khan.
